description:
i'm using 12.04 and

nova-novncproxy service from this package fails with following error:

# /usr/bin/nova-novncproxy --flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/nova-novncproxy", line 40, in <module>
    flags.DEFINE_boolean('verbose', False,
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'DEFINE_boolean'

It seems that the package has e3 (essex-3 milestone i guess) version, but it can't work with the essex-4 or later release.

I tried the master branch from https://github.com/cloudbuilders/noVNC and it works flawlessly.

I think that the package update is highly recommended.
title: novncproxy crashes on flags parsing, update is needed

comments.content:
i'm using 12.04 and

nova-novncproxy service from this package fails with following error:

# /usr/bin/nova-novncproxy --flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/nova-novncproxy", line 40, in <module>
    flags.DEFINE_boolean('verbose', False,
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'DEFINE_boolean'

It seems that the package has e3 (essex-3 milestone i guess) version, but it can't work with the essex-4 or later release.

I tried the master branch from https://github.com/cloudbuilders/noVNC and it works flawlessly.

I think that the package update is highly recommended.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~a-gordeev

comments.content: This bug is not part of Horizon and there's nothing we can do in our codebase to fix it; closing it for this project.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gabriel-hurley

comments.content: Status changed to 'Confirmed' because the bug affects multiple users.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor

comments.content:
This is fixed in Debian, version 2012.1~e3+dfsg+1-2.
See also bug #985274.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~adri2000
